metadata.title: CVE-2020-36309 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
ngx_http_lua_module (aka lua-nginx-module) before 0.10.16 in OpenRestyallows unsafe characters in an argument when using the API to mutate a URI,or a request or response header.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36309` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnginx-mod-http-auth-pam - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-cache-purge - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-dav-ext - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-echo - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-fancyindex - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-geoip2 - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-headers-more-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-image-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-ndk - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-perl - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-subs-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-uploadprogress - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-upstream-fair - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-http-xslt-filter - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-mail - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-nchan - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-rtmp - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-stream - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-stream-geoip - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
libnginx-mod-stream-geoip2 - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
nginx - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
nginx-common - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
nginx-core - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
nginx-extras - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
nginx-full - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
nginx-light - 1.18.0-6ubuntu8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.18.0-6ubuntu8').
